properties.author: Carl Wilson & Paul Wheatley
properties.name: British Library Newspapers
properties.description: Assessment of preservation options for the JISC1 newspaper collection master TIFF images, prior to ingest into the BL Digital Library System for long term preservation.

basis.documentTypes: 2 million TIFF master copies of A3 newspaper pages.
basis.designatedCommunity: MASTERS The British Library Digital Preservation Team (digital preservation expertise). The British Library Newspaper Programme (curatorial expertise for newspaper collection). The British Library Digital Library Programme (development of preservation level digital object store). DERIVED ACCESS COPIES Academic and independent researchers, and genealogists.
basis.mandate: To preserve and provide long term access to digital material.
basis.planningPurpose: To consider options for reducing the total cost of ownership for the collection, whilst minimising preservation risk.

trigger.description: The collection has been held on LTO tape for 2 years. Worries about suitability of the tapes for long term preservation led to the material been taken from tape onto Hard Drive storage on a SAN to review the state of the material. This move highlighted difficulties reading the content of some of the tapes. The decision was made to move the master files into the BL's Digital Library System. Before the ingest into DLS was performed, it was decided to review the format of the current master files to see if the current TIFF format was the most suitable for long term preservation.

policy.name: Target format shall be OPEN, unless impossible
Target format must have open specification
Target format specification must be available
File formats of output manifestations must be supported by existing hard- and software
Compression must be lossless
Target format must not have encryption
Target size must not be larger than source (0 being not applicable)
Metadata have to be preserved unaltered
All metadata as described in institutional set of metadata have to be preserved
Content has to be preserved unaltered
At least 2 digital copies for digitised materials have to be created
Original copies must never be deleted
Derivate copies which can be derived from others shall not be archived
With every preservation action old derived files shall be retained
Preservation action must be validated for authenticity of the substantive content
Preservation action must be documented with target object to be able to trace changes
Metadata about original hard- and software has to be preserved
Metadata about hard- and software at this moment has to be preserved
Target content must be reliable
Target content must maintain quality
There shall be expertise for the preservation action
Cost of chosen preservation action must not exceed estimated value of items
Cost of preservartion action must not exceed preservation budget
Best practice in active preservation management shall be followed
Standard must be compliant with METS
Standard must be compliant with MODS
Standard must be compliant with Premis
Standard must be compliant with MIX
Preservation action tool shall be OPEN SOURCE
Preservation action tool shall be FREE OF COST
Tools for digital preservation shall be built and written by employees of the organisation
Digital preservation programming shall be done according programming best practices
Servers must be protected by power surge protection systems
Disaster recovery procedures must be in place
Adequate storage capacity must be maintained for all holdings
Two physical systems, on which the documents are stored, shall be in two different buildings
Preservation system shall consist of on-site, near-site and off-site storage
Adequate connectivity shall be provided
Preservation action must be emulation
Preservation action must be migration
Preservation action must create platform independent objects
Preservation actions shall be accompanied with formal documentation specified in the preservation strategy procedures
Preservation action must be without compression unless no information loss occurs
Prefer preservation actions which are more stable
Prefer preservation actions which are better supported
Prefer preservation actions which produce target outputs which satisfy the main user needs
Preservation action shall optimise the use of space for storage purposes

sampleRecords.samplesDescription: The samples were chosen by newspaper curators to represent typical image quality, poor quality images, non-text images, and small text images.

collectionProfile.description: Master copies of digitised 19th century newspaper collection.

record.description: Aberdeen Journal front page 17/07/1884. Poor quality image.
The Freemans Journal, 19/08/1882, second page. A small text image.
The Leeds mercury, 07/02/1807 front page. A typical good quality image, representative of the majority of the collection.

alternative.name: Do Nothing
alternative.description: Do not migrate the master files to an alternative format and retain them as TIFF v5 files.

resourceDescription.necessaryResources: Preservation storage for 2 million TIFF master files. Time and network resources to move the originals from there current location.
resourceDescription.reasonForConsidering: Eliminates the preservation risks introduced by format migration. Removes process costs incurred by the mass migration of 2 million image files.

experiment.description: No action taken, simply retain the master image as a TIFF v5 file.

alternative.name: TIFF to PNG
alternative.description: Convert TIFF v5 masters to PNG using service at http://localhost:8080/pserv-pa-imagemagick/ImageMagickMigrate?wsdl.

resourceDescription.reasonForConsidering: PNG is a well documented and open standard that may be suitable for long term preservation and will be considered as an alternative.

experiment.description: Convert to PNG using ImageMagick: convert master.tif master.png

alternative.name: TIFF to BMP
alternative.description: Convert TIFF v5 masters to Windows Bitmap format.

resourceDescription.reasonForConsidering: Windows BMP is an uncompressed format that will be reviewed as a candidate for long term preservation of the newspaper masters.

alternative.name: TIFF to GIF
alternative.description: Convert the TIFF v5 masters to the Graphic Interchange Format.

resourceDescription.reasonForConsidering: The GIF format uses lossless compression, the patents covering the compression routines that initiated the development of the PNG standard in the 1990s have since expired.

alternative.name: TIFF to JPEG
alternative.description: Convert the TIFF v5 masters to the JPEG format using service at http://localhost:8080/pserv-pa-imagemagick/ImageMagickMigrate?wsdl.

resourceDescription.reasonForConsidering: JPEG is an open and ubiquitous standard with strong support. JPEG compression will be used to save space by cutting down the size of the master images.

experiment.description: Convert to JPEG using ImageMagick: convert master.tif master.jpg

alternative.name: TIFF to JPEG 2000
alternative.description: Convert TIFF v5 masters to JPEG 2000 format using service at http://localhost:8080/pserv-pa-imagemagick/ImageMagickMigrate?wsdl.

experiment.description: Convert to JPEG 2000 using ImageMagick: convert master.tif master.jp2

alternative.name: TIFF to JP2 95
alternative.description: Convert to JP2 at 95 compression using service at http://localhost:8080/pserv-pa-imagemagick/ImageMagickMigrate?wsdl.

resourceDescription.reasonForConsidering: To investigate the space saving benefits of JP2K lossy compression versus the affect on image quality.

experiment.description: Convert to JPEG 2000 using ImageMagick: convert -quality 95 master.tif master.jp2

alternative.name: TIFF to JP2 90
alternative.description: Convert to JP2 at 90 compression using service at http://localhost:8080/pserv-pa-imagemagick/ImageMagickMigrate?wsdl.

resourceDescription.reasonForConsidering: To investigate the space saving benefits of JP2K lossy compression versus the affect on image quality.

experiment.description: Convert to JPEG 2000 using ImageMagick: convert -quality 90 master.tif master.jp2

alternative.name: TIFF to JP2 80
alternative.description: Convert to JP2 at 80 compression using service at http://localhost:8080/pserv-pa-imagemagick/ImageMagickMigrate?wsdl.

resourceDescription.reasonForConsidering: To investigate the space saving benefits of JP2K lossy compression versus the affect on image quality.

experiment.description: Convert to JPEG 2000 using ImageMagick: convert -quality 80 master.tif master.jp2

decision.reason: TIF v5, PNG, JPG and JPG 2000 are all potentially viable formats for long term preservation of the BL's newspaper master images. GIF and BMP were ruled out, GIF due to the palette size limitations (only 256 colours), and BMPs due to the large file sizes and lack of compression options.
decision.actionNeeded: Perform some test migrations and investigate the properties of the formats and the conversions tools.

recommendation.reasoning: Although little to choose between TIFF and JPEG 2000, the smaller JPEG 2000 files will reduce the long term preservation costs. TIFF is not a recognized ISO standard either.
recommendation.effects: There is a one off cost of migration of the TIFF masters to JPEG 2000. The ingest and long term storage costs for the Digital Library System should be reduced.

property.description: Quantitative archival storage costs per object over a time period of 10 years.

property.description: Elapsed processing time used per MB, measured in milliseconds.

property.description: Possibilies to identify the outcome format.

alternative.comment: Cannot easily obtain TIFF version number

property.name: complexity
property.description: Complexity of the outcome format.

property.name: relative filesize
property.description: Factor for relative output file size, calculated as: (size of output file / size of input file)

property.description: Indicates to which degree the activities performed by the action-tool are traceable.

property.name: reliability: runtime stability
property.description: Runtime stability of the action-tool.

property.description: Assessment of how easy it is to integrate the action-tool into the current used server environment.
